title: Output Shaft - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Only the torsional damper and the retaining plate is to be removed from the output shaft.
The output shaft assembly is not to be disassembled. If an item of the output shaft requires replacing, the complete output shaft assembly must be replaced.
Make sure the gear selection is in neutral before removing the output shaft.
Remove the M22 sealing plug and its O-ring located below the torsional damper housing.
Carefully remove the fixing securing the output retaining plate to the upper crankcase.
There could be one or more shims between the bearing cap and the output shaft retaining plate.
Note the position of the shims for installation.
Remove the fixings securing the output shaft retaining plate to the transmission bearing cap. Discard the fixings.
If fitted, remove the shim(s) and retain for installation.
For the transmission bearing cap there are two M6 x 30 mm and two M8 x 65 mm fixings.
Note the position of the fixings for installation.
Progressively release the transmission bearing cap fixings in the sequence shown below.
Note there is a washer between the output shaft and the upper crankcase for installation.
Note the position of the two gear selector forks for installation.
Carefully lift out the output shaft, torsional damper and output retaining plate from the upper crankcase.
Note that the retaining plate has an OUT marking and it is facing towards the torsional damper for installation.
Remove the torsional damper and the retaining plate from the output shaft. If necessary, use a soft faced mallet to gently tap the torsional damper off the output shaft.

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Only the torsional damper and the retaining plate is to be removed from the output shaft.
The output shaft assembly is not to be disassembled. If an item of the output shaft requires replacing, the complete output shaft assembly must be replaced.
Make sure the gear selection is in neutral before removing the output shaft.
Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal
Engine - Removal
Throttle Body - Removal
Transmission Cover - Removal
Remove the M22 sealing plug and its O-ring located below the torsional damper housing.
Carefully remove the fixing securing the output retaining plate to the upper crankcase.

Torsional damper housing
Fixing
There could be one or more shims between the bearing cap and the output shaft retaining plate.
Note the position of the shims for installation.
Remove the fixings securing the output shaft retaining plate to the transmission bearing cap. Discard the fixings.
Fixings
If fitted, remove the shim(s) and retain for installation.
For the transmission bearing cap there are two M6 x 30 mm and two M8 x 65 mm fixings.
Note the position of the fixings for installation.
Progressively release the transmission bearing cap fixings in the sequence shown below.
Transmission Bearing Cap Release Sequence
Remove the transmission bearing cap.
Note there is a washer between the output shaft and the upper crankcase for installation.
Note the position of the two gear selector forks for installation.
Carefully lift out the output shaft, torsional damper and output retaining plate from the upper crankcase.
Note that the retaining plate has an OUT marking and it is facing towards the torsional damper for installation.
Remove the torsional damper and the retaining plate from the output shaft. If necessary, use a soft faced mallet to gently tap the torsional damper off the output shaft.
